baby_monitor.name: Baby Monitor
baby_monitor.description: Tells you your current Overwatch Score without needing an action.

browse.name: Browse
browse.description: When doing Matrix searches, gain 1 Edge that is either spent immediately on that action or disappears.

configurator.name: Configurator
configurator.description: Store alternate deck configuration, swap to it instead of changing two attributes.

edit.name: Edit
edit.description: When doing Edit File action, gain 1 Edge that must be immediately spent or else it vanishes.

encryption.name: Encryption
encryption.description: +2 dice when doing Encrypt File action

virtual_machine.name: Virtual Machine
virtual_machine.description: 2 extra program slots; take 1 extra box of unresisted Matrix damage when attacked

biofeedback.name: Biofeedback
biofeedback.description: Causes Stun (if target is in cold-sim) or Physical (if target is in hot-sim) damage with Matrix attack. This program is linked to the Attack attribute.

biofeedback_filter.name: Biofeedback Filter
biofeedback_filter.description: Allow Device Rating or Body roll to soak Matrix damage.

blackout.name: Blackout
blackout.description: Like Biofeedback, but Stun damage only. This program is linked to the Attack attribute.

defuse.name: Defuse
defuse.description: Allow Device Rating or Body roll to soak damage from Data Bomb.

exploit.name: Exploit
exploit.description: Reduce Defense Rating of hacking target by 2.

fork.name: Fork
fork.description: Hit two targets with a single Matrix action without splitting dice pools.

lockdown.name: Lockdown
lockdown.description: Cause link-lock when you do Matrix damage.

overclock.name: Overclock
overclock.description: Add two dice to a Matrix action. One of them must be the wild die.

stealth.name: Stealth
stealth.description: When performing a Hide action, gain 1 Edge that must be spent as part of the action or vanish. This program is linked to the Sleaze attribute.

trace.name: Trace
trace.description: When performing a Trace Icon action, gain 1 Edge that must be spent as part of the action or vanish. This program is linked to the Sleaze attribute.

backdoor_entry.name: Backdoor Entry
backdoor_entry.description: You attempt to use a backdoor you have put in place to gain illicit entry into a host, device, or other Matrix area. This action can only be used if you have previously used Probe on the target suc- cessfully; net hits from that successful Probe count as a dice-pool bonus on this test. If the test is suc- cessful, you gain Admin access to the target, and it does not count as illegal Admin access (though taking illegal Matrix Actions will still increase your Overwatch Score). If this test fails, the back- door you have made was detected and removed, and you cannot attempt Backdoor Entry again with the same host until a new backdoor is made through the Probe Action. Failing this test does not immediately set off alarms, but the character’s OS increases as normal.

brute_force.name: Brute Force
brute_force.description: You directly attack a device, flooding it with re- quests, commands, queries, and other junk code in order to create an exploit to give you access. Brute Force is by far the fastest way to gain illicit access to a device, but it carries with it many risks. Using Brute Force will always alert the device you are at- tempting to gain access to, so GOD score accumu- lates with each test. Should you fail a Brute Force attempt to gain access, you may attempt another on the next combat round.     If the hacker is attempting to gain User or Admin access, the opposed roll is Willpower + Firewall. When attempting to gain Admin access without first having gained User access, the opposed roll is Will- power + (Firewall + 2), and the target is granted a +4 bonus to their Defense Rating for that Test. This action is linked to the Attack attribute.

change_icon.name: Change Icon
change_icon.description: You change the target’s icon to one that you have a copy of or have designed yourself. Chang- ing an icon doesn’t change the results of a Matrix Perception action but might fool personas who don’t take the time to inspect your new look. You can target your own icon, if you like.

check_os.name: Check OS
check_os.description: If your test is successful, you are informed ofyour current Overwatch Score.

control_device.name: Control Device
control_device.description: This action allows extended remote control of a device. You maintain control until you relin- quish command or are forced out of the system. While you have control, you can use the device as if you were the owner using a standard skill test, including turning the device off if you have Admin access. If there is no test associated with the device you wish to use, use Electronics + Logic vs. Firewall + Willpower. This test assumes you are using the device directly, not command- ing a device to use another (such as commanding a drone to fire its weapon). A Control Device action versus a device currently “jumped into” by a rigger automatically fails.     When you use Control Device, you may take any action that would normally require the level of access you currently have. Hacking User access allows you to take any action that would normally require legitimate User access. Actions that nor- mally require legitimate Admin access will likewise require hacked Admin access to perform.

crack_file.name: Crack File
crack_file.description: You remove the protection from a file, making it readable.

crash_program.name: Crash Program
crash_program.description: You overload part of your target’s memory and scramble one of its running programs. You need to specify which program you’re trying to crash; you can learn what your target is running either with a Matrix Perception action or by observing the program in action. If you succeed, the program is scrambled: it ends and cannot be restarted until the device it was running on is rebooted.

data_spike.name: Data Spike
data_spike.description: You send harmful instructions to a persona or device, causing Matrix damage to the target. Your attack has a Damage Value equal to your [Attack Attribute/2, rounded up], with one additional box of damage per net hit. This action is linked to the Attack attribute.

disarm_data_bomb.name: Disarm Databomb
disarm_data_bomb.description: You attempt to disarm a Data Bomb that you have detected (usually as the result of a Matrix Perception action). If you score any net hits, the Data Bomb is removed and deleted. If not, the Data Bomb activates, causing its damage and possibly destroying any file to which it was attached (assuming it was set to destroy the file).

edit_file.name: Edit File
edit_file.description: Edit File allows you to create, change, copy, delete, or protect any kind of file. The defender is either the host holding the file or the owner of the file (if it’s not on a host). Each action is enough to alter one detail of a file—a short paragraph of text, a single detail of an image, or two or three seconds of video or audio (you and your gamemaster can work out what exactly “one detail” means). Your gamemaster may impose penalties on the test if your edit is particularly intricate or tricky. If you want to perform a continuous edit, such as removing your teammates from a video feed, you need to perform this action once per combat round for as long as you want to keep the edit going. If you use this action to copy a file, you are the new file’s owner. If the file you want to copy has protection on it, this action automatically fails. If the file has a Data Bomb, the Data Bomb goes off on you (so try to remember to scan files before you open them).

encrypt_file.name: Encrypt File
encrypt_file.description: The hits on the Encrypt File test establish an Encryption Rating that’s used to oppose future Crack File attempts.

enter_host.name: Enter Host
enter_host.description: You enter or leave a host. No test is required, but different hosts have different access levels, so you must have the appropriate access to enter. Leaving can be done without any particular access level, because the Matrix is always happy to see interlopers leave

erase_matrix_signature.name: Erase Matrix Signature
erase_matrix_signature.description: You eradicate a Matrix signature that has been left by a Resonance being, such as a technomancer or a sprite. If the test is successful, the signature dissipates. You must have a Resonance rating to attempt this action. Unlike other actions that need Resonance, this one’s a real Matrix Action, and illegal to boot, so you risk Matrix damage and Overwatch Score when you use it.

format_device.name: Format Device
format_device.description: You rewrite the boot code of the target device. The next time it would reboot, it instead shuts down for good, or until its software can be replaced. A device that has been shut down in this fashion loses all of its wireless modifiers but can still be used as a normal mechanism (a door with a manual handle can be opened, a gun with a trigger can be fired, etc.), and it cannot be accessed from the Matrix. Repairing a formatted device follows the same rules as repairing a bricked device (see Bricked Devices, p. 175), requiring a number of hits equal to the device’s Device Rating to restore the corrupted boot code.

full_matrix_defense.name: Full Matrix Defense
full_matrix_defense.description: This action is the Matrix equivalent of Full Defense (p. 43). Until the end of the combat round, add your Firewall to all Matrix-based defense tests. This is an Anytime action that may be taken outside your turn.

hash_check.name: Hash Check
hash_check.description: This is a specialized Matrix search, made illegal by the fact that it searches for an encrypted file by matching it to a hash value (GOD does not appreciate people trying to skirt encryption). By searching for a specific value, the characters can find an encrypted document on a host or device without first having to decrypt every document to find the right one. This works best if Mr. Johnson provided the hash value to them, but in a pinch the search can be done with the character’s best guess. The threshold is 1 if you have a hash value from Mr. Johnson or some other source, 4 if you are doing the best on your own. Meeting the threshold means you have narrowed the number of possibly matching files down to 32; for every net hit, that number is divided in half (so there are 16 files with 1 net hit, 8 with 2, etc.). If the number of possible matches still seems too large after the initial test, the test can be repeated with the –2 dice pool penalty for repeating an action (see p. 36). Success on this subsequent test, along with any net hits, serves to divide the number of possible matches in half.

hide.name: Hide
hide.description: When you muck about in the Matrix, you’ll probably be spotted by another icon, even if you’re running silent. You can use this action to make a target lose you. If you succeed, the target stops spotting you and needs to perform a new Matrix Perception action against you if it wants to find you again. You can’t hide from an icon that has gained User or Admin access to anything in your network.

jack_out.name: Jack Out
jack_out.description: This action jacks you out of the Matrix and reboots the device you are using. You suffer dumpshock if you were in VR. The defense pool only applies if you’ve been link-locked by someone; the test is against the icon that locked your link. If more than one persona has you link-locked, you need to beat each of them individually: use a single roll and compare your hits to rolls from each opponent who had established a link-lock. You can only jack out yourself. You can’t dump other people except by beating them into submission through Matrix damage.

jam_signals.name: Jam Signals
jam_signals.description: This action turns the wireless device you are using into a local jammer. As long as you do not use the device for any further Matrix actions, the device adds any hits you get on the test to the noise rating for all Matrix actions conducted by or targeting any devices within 100 meters. If you want selective jamming or directional jamming, buy a jammer—that’s what they’re for.

jump_rigged.name: Jump Rigged
jump_rigged.description: You jump into a device that has a rigger adaptation, usually a vehicle or a drone. There’s a list of things you need to have in order to jump into a device: you have to have the proper access level on the device you want to jump into, you have to be in VR, the device you want to jump into has to have a rigger adaptation, and you have to have a control rig. If you are the device’s owner, or the device’s owner has given you permission to jump into the device, you don’t need to make a test. In the Matrix, the icon of the device you jumped into becomes part of your persona and it cannot be targeted by matrix actions while you are jumped in. If someone else is currently jumped into the device, you cannot attempt this action.

matrix_perception.name: Matrix Perception
matrix_perception.description: A successful test gives you information about the target. With a tie, you can perceive the item’s icon. A single net hit will give you basic information, such as device rating, or whatever name the device or icon calls itself. Two net hits will give you more specific information, including individual attribute ratings, and what programs it is currently running. Additional hits will give you more information based on what the gamemaster wishes to reveal. This test can also be used to attempt to spot any icons in the vicinity that are running silent.

matrix_search.name: Matrix Search
matrix_search.description: Search the publicly accessible grid for information. The number of hits generated gives you more information regarding the subject. Use the Legwork Results table (p. 50) as a general guideline for what is uncovered.

probe.name: Probe
probe.description: You probe a network for weaknesses, looking to gain access. By taking your time not to alert any security to your presence, you can create an exploit that may last until you are ready to use it. While not as fast as using Brute Force, Probing a network does not raise an alarm automatically. Even if your attempt initially fails, it will not trigger an alarm unless you glitch. A successful Probe creates a backdoor in the system to exploit. Once you create the exploit, you may then use the Backdoor Entry action at a later time. Net hits on this test count as a dice pool bonus on your future Backdoor Entry test. The duration of these backdoors depends on the PAN or host—most systems create a changelog and will automatically correct and report differences to their configurations caused by the presence of these exploits. Generally speaking, the backdoor lasts for [10 – Host/Device Rating] hours or until you go offline. This action is linked to the Sleaze attribute.

reboot_device.name: Reboot Device
reboot_device.description: The target device, persona, or PAN goes offline and comes back online at the end of the following combat round. The target’s Overwatch Score and any access achieved on or by the target is reset. No dumpshock occurs from rebooting. You cannot reboot if you are link-locked.

reconfigure.name: Reconfigure
reconfigure.description: Swap the base ratings of two non-zero attributes of your Matrix Persona, even if the numbers are rooted in different devices. See Personas and Attributes (p. 174) for more information on Matrix Attributes, and the Matrix Attribute Adjustments sidebar (p. 178) for an example

send_message.name: Send Message
send_message.description: You send a text or audio message the length of a short sentence, an image, or a file via the Matrix to a user whose commcode you have. If you’re using the Matrix through a DNI, even if you’re in AR, you can send longer and more complicated messages, about a paragraph worth of text. You can also use this action to open a live feed to one or more recipients, using any digital recording devices you have.

set_data_bomb.name: Set Databomb
set_data_bomb.description: You set a Data Bomb in a file. Choose the rating of the Data Bomb, up to the net hits on your test. You also need to choose whether or not the Data Bomb will delete the file to which it is attached when activated, and the passcode required to deactivate it. A file can only have one Data Bomb on it at a time. The Data Bomb is triggered when someone attempts to read, edit, copy, protect, delete, or place another Data Bomb on the file without disarming the Data Bomb that’s already in place. When a Data Bomb goes off, it causes (Rating x 2) Matrix Damage (resisted with Willpower) to the icon that tripped it, deletes the file (if it was set that way), and then is itself deleted. If the passcode is used, the Data Bomb doesn’t activate. Instead, it remains attached to the file, waiting for the next guy. A Data Bomb can be detected using Matrix Perception. If it’s detected, it can be defused with the Disarm Data Bomb action; a disarmed Data Bomb is deleted.

snoop.name: Snoop
snoop.description: This action lets you intercept Matrix traffic sent to and from your target for as long as you have access. You can listen to, view, or read this data live, or you can save it for later playback/viewing if you have something to store it on (your deck or commlink will do).

spoof_command.name: Spoof Command
spoof_command.description: You send a signal to a device with a command the target perceives as coming from its owner. The device then automatically attempts to perform the action as its next available major action.

switch_ifmode.name: Switch IF Mode
switch_ifmode.description: You switch your interface from AR to VR, or back.

tarpit.name: Tarpit
tarpit.description: Sometimes you want to deliver as much hurt as possible; sometimes you want to deliver a little pain and a little slowness, in order to make the rest of your blows land easier. If you succeed in making this attack, do (1 + net hits) damage to the icon you attacked while also reducing their Data Processing rating by the same amount. If a device’s Data Processing rating is reduced to 0, the user cannot perform a Matrix action until it is 1 or more. The Data Processing rating recovers at a rate of 1 point per combat round.

trace_icon.name: Trace Icon
trace_icon.description: You find the physical location of a device or persona in the Matrix. After succeeding with this action, you know the target’s location for as long as you can detect the target. This doesn’t work on IC or hosts that have no physical location, but it does work on offline hosts with physical hardware (although if you can access one of those to trace it, you probably know where it is already).

change_focus.name: Activate/Deactivate Focus
change_focus.description: A character can activate or deactivate a bonded focus that they are carrying on their person with a Minor Action.

avoid_incoming.name: Avoid Incoming
avoid_incoming.description: A character can use this action when it is not their player turn to get away from an incoming Blast or Gas attack. With this action, a character makes a Reaction + Athletics – Dodge Penalty roll (see Dodge Penalty table, p. 311, for these values). Hits on the test allow a character to move a number of meters equal to their hits in a direction of their choosing, but they shouldn’t know the results of the scatter until after they decide which way they’re headed. If they choose to move more than 2 meters, they dive to the ground at the end of their defense and gain the Prone status. This action cannot be used if the character has taken a previous Avoid Incoming, Move, or Sprint action this combat round and prevents the use of another Avoid Incoming, Move, or Sprint action for the remainder of the combat round.

block.name: Block
block.description: A character can add their Close Combat skill to a single Defense test in melee. The roll must happen in the same player turn in which the action is used.

call_shot.name: Call a Shot
call_shot.description: Edge allows for some specific called shots without dice penalty or with reduced penalty, but yo can increase the damage by 2 by taking a –4 dic pool penalty. This must be combined with the Attack action.

change_device_mode.name: Change Device Mode
change_device_mode.description: A character may use a Minor Action to activate deactivate, or switch the mode on any device tha they are linked to by a direct neural interface, b it a wired or wireless link. This includes activatin or deactivating cyberware, changing a smartgun’ firing settings, switching a commlink to hidde mode, turning a device’s wireless functionality off and so on.

command_drone.name: Command Drone
command_drone.description: A character may issue a command to a dron they control. If multiple drones are controlle through a rigger command console (RCC), th same command can be issued to every drone. I a different command is desired for each drone, i requires multiple Minor Actions.

command_spirit.name: Command Spirit
command_spirit.description: A character may issue a service command to  single spirit or group of spirits under their control, or dismiss them. The service must be th same. If multiple services are desired, multipl Minor Actions must be used.

dodge.name: Dodge
dodge.description: A character can add their Athletics skill to a single Defense test in combat. The roll must happe in the same player turn in which the action is used.

drop_object.name: Drop Object
drop_object.description: A character may drop an object they are holding in their hand or hands as a single Minor Action. The objects fall to the ground and may suffe damage or ill effects if the gamemaster so chooses depending on the distance of the fall and the landing spot.

drop_prone.name: Drop Prone
drop_prone.description: A character may choose to drop themselves t the ground as a Minor Action. They gain the Pron status (p. 53) until they choose to use the Stand U Action.

hit_the_dirt.name: Hit the Dirt
hit_the_dirt.description: A character can quickly drop to the ground i a defensive manner, gaining +2 dice on the Defens test of an incoming attack. They gain the Prone status (p. 53), but due to the awkwardness of their fall they suffer a –2 dice pool penalty on any subsequen tests using active skills until the end of their nex turn, unless they use the Stand Up action.

intercept.name: Intercept
intercept.description: If an opponent comes within Close attack range you may go out of Initiative order and make an Attack action as long as you have both a Minor and  Major Action still available in this round (becaus block exampl Caboose and Whitney are taking on a couple of gan enforcers. They’re both built for speed, so they both g before the enforcers. Caboose decides to Move, Quic Draw a weapon, Take Aim, Call a Shot, and Attack, usin up his full allotment of actions for this combat round.

move.name: Move
move.description: A character can use this Minor Action for 10 meters of movement. Only one Move Action is allowed per player turn.

multiple_attacks.name: Multiple Attacks
multiple_attacks.description: A character can attack more than one opponent, assuming ammunition, reach, and enem placement allow it. Split your dice pool evenl among all targets, or if you are using two differen forms of attack, use half the dice pool for each rounded down. This action must be used in conjunction with an Attack Major Action.

quick_draw.name: Quick Draw
quick_draw.description: A character may quick draw a pistol, pistol-sized weapon, or small throwing weapon an immediately attack with this Minor Action. Th Attack action must be used in conjunction wit this action. They must have the appropriate gear augmentation, or quality to be allowed this action—if they don’t have something that allows thi action, they can’t take it.

reload_smartgun.name: Reload Smartgun
reload_smartgun.description: A character linked to a ready smartgun may us a mental command to eject the weapon’s clip whil sliding a new one in with one deft motion, assuming that the new ammo is readily available.

shift_perception.name: Shift Perception
shift_perception.description: A character capable of Astral Perception may shif perception to or from astral space as a Minor Action.

stand_up.name: Stand Up
stand_up.description: Whether they chose to be prone or they go knocked down, a character uses this action to get bac to their feet and remove the Prone status (p. 53).

take_aim.name: Take Aim
take_aim.description: A character gains a +1 dice pool bonus with th use of this action. The action can only be taken onc per combat round, but if the bonus is not used, i carries over to the next combat round, allowing it t be combined with actions taken over the course o several combat rounds. If the character takes a player turn without taking the Take Aim or Attack actions, any carryover bonuses from previous round are lost. The maximum dice pool bonus from th use of this action is equal to the character’s Willpower. A character may take aim with a ready firearm, bow, or exotic ranged weapon. If the character is using vision magnificatio or a targeting scope, the Take Aim action must b used to line up the shot in order to receive an bonus from the item. In this case, the first action o Take Aim does not provide any additional bonu beyond enabling the function of the modification.

take_cover.name: Take Cover
take_cover.description: The character uses something in their area t provide protection, but they also must operat from the constraints created by the cover. Takin cover gives the player the Cover I, II, III, or IV status (see p. 52).

trip.name: Trip
trip.description: This action focuses more on bringing the targe to the ground than on doing damage. It can onl be done with a melee attack and must be combine with an Attack Major Action. Decrease the bas damage of the attack by 2; if it hits, target roll Athletics + Agility with a threshold of the adjuste DV of the attack. If the target fails, they gain th Prone status.

assist.name: Assist
assist.description: You can become a helper on a Teamwork test working to help one of your teammates on som task (see Teamwork Tests, p. 36).

astral_projection.name: Astral Projection
astral_projection.description: A character capable of Astral Projection (ful magician or aspected magician) may shift thei consciousness to or from the astral plane as a Major Action. The process is complete the momen the action is declared and therefore places the on the astral plane immediately, including for th remainder of the current combat round.

attack.name: Attack
attack.description: A character may perform one of a variety o forms of attack with this Major Action. See th Combat chapter (p. 104) for more details.

banish_spirit.name: Banish Spirit
banish_spirit.description: Any character may attempt a Banishing on  spirit as a Major Action (see Banishing, p. 147).

cast_spell.name: Cast Spell
cast_spell.description: A character may cast a spell as a Major Action. For details on how, see Spells (p. 130).

cleanse.name: Cleanse
cleanse.description: Awakened characters use this action to eras traces of their magic activity (see p. 160).

full_defense.name: Full Defense
full_defense.description: A character can add their Willpower to all Defense tests until the end of the combat round.

manifest.name: Manifest
manifest.description: Characters who are astrally projecting use thi action to appear as a ghostly form (see p. 160).

observe_in_detail.name: Observe In Detail
observe_in_detail.description: A character may make a detailed observation b taking a Major Action. This action allows a Perception test (see Perception, p. 96) or Assensing test (p.159). This action is intended for determining detail that may be obscured due to the pace and rigor of combat. It is assumed that everyone engaged i a combat is aware of the presence of everyone else, barring the use of Stealth or obscuring magic, but no necessarily details of their gear or equipment, and i some particularly hectic or rushed circumstances, th identity of individuals. In the midst of a hectic gunfight/brawl in the dark, the winner of the brawl, wh is now sprinting toward your character, may not b identifiable without an Observe in Detail action.

manipulate_object.name: Pickup/Put Down Object
manipulate_object.description: A character may pick up an object within reac or put down one that they were holding as a Majo Action. This action means care is taken to put th object down or pick it up. If the picked-up objec is a weapon, this counts as readying the weapon.

ready_weapon.name: Ready Weapon
ready_weapon.description: A character may ready a weapon by usin this action. This includes drawing and readyin a firearm; pulling a melee weapon from a sheat or pocket; taking out and readying a grenad or throwing knife; or any other kind of weapo preparation. Almost all weapons require this action before they are ready for use, though man times it occurs before combat even starts. Small weapons such as throwing knives an shuriken can be readied in bunches, with a tota number equal to the character’s Agility attribut pulled into the character’s off-hand with a single Ready Weapon action.

reload_weapon.name: Reload Weapon
reload_weapon.description: Weapons without a smartlink, or weapon where the smartlink is currently disengaged, requir a Major Action to reload. Reloading a weapon refills the weapon to its maximum capacity as long a the character has sufficient ammunition to do so.

rigger_jump_in.name: Rigger Jump In
rigger_jump_in.description: A character with a vehicle control rig (VCR) an rigger-adapted vehicle or drone or a rigger command console (RCC) may jump in to control th vehicle or operate the RCC with a Major Action.

sprint.name: Sprint
sprint.description: A character may move at a Sprint with this Majo Action. Movement starts at 15 meters and is increase by 1 meter per hit on an Athletics + Agility Test. Onl one Sprint Action is allowed per player turn, and i cannot be performed in the same turn as a Move action or Avoid Incoming action.

summon_spirit.name: Summon Spirit
summon_spirit.description: A character capable of summoning may use  Major Action to summon a spirit to assist them.  spirit that is already summoned is controlled usin the Command Spirit Minor Action.

use_simple_device.name: Use Simple Device
use_simple_device.description: A character can use any simple device with  Major Action. Simple devices are those that are activated with a simple movement like a thumb trigger pressing a single key, or tapping a single icon. It takes longer to interact with more comple devices, with required time being up to the gamemaster or listed with the description of specific gear.Remember, a device connected via a DNI-enabled system uses the Minor Action.

use_skill.name: Use Skill
use_skill.description: A character may use an appropriate skill by using a Major Action (see Skills, p. 92).

add_edge_pool.name: Add Edge to Pool + Explode
add_edge_pool.description: Add your Edge as a dice pool bonus to your roll, and make 6s explode. “Exploding” means that 6s count as a hit and can be rerolled in an attempt to get an additional hit. If another hit is scored, tack it on; if another 6 is rolled, tack on a hit and roll it again. Keep the hits coming! If a 1 is rolled after a 6, it does not count toward your total for calculating glitches.

count_2_glitch.name: Count 2's as glitches for target
count_2_glitch.description: Count 2s as glitches for the target

heal_1_stun.name: Heal 1 Stun
heal_1_stun.description: Heal one box of Stun damage

plus_1_roll.name: +1 to a Roll
plus_1_roll.description: +1 to a single die. This automatically searches first to replace glitches until we dont glitch, and then replaces 4's to become a hit.

reroll_one.name: Reroll One die
reroll_one.description: Reroll one die. This automatically rerolls the lowest dice roll.
